title: Circe - Madeline Miller

title: Dhall: The Config Language That Actually Scales With Us
Why We‚Äôre Getting Poorer: A Realist's Guide to the Economy and How We Can Fix it - Cahal Moran
Normal People - Sally Rooney
description: Their relationship is 100% something in the end. Marianne being called his girlfriend after all those phases of uncertainty - was it nothing? Something? Definitely something? But also nothing? yh, it was worth the wait. The separations and the phases of life they faced individually and together really changed them. As the narrator says, 'People can really change one another.' And in the end, when they are finally comfortable showing they are explicitly in each other's lives, they‚Äôve overcome the very thing that had created a wall between them. Pretty rich character development I would say.

title: People We Meet on Vacation - Emily Henry
description:
**Notes to self:**
1. Take the vacation, meet strangers who might become stories, and step into the unknown without fear.
2. Find my Poppy who feels like home and adventure at once.
3. Love her the way Poppy loves Alex.

title: Paper Heart - Cecelia Ahern

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck - Mark Manson
description: I hate to say this, but as mainstream as this book is, it still has some valuable insights that often go overlooked. When Mark is right, he's really right - and honestly, this book is underrated for what it actually deserves credit for.

title: How to Hold Someone in Your Heart - Mizuki Tsujimura
